passage:
(1) Sustainable urban planning has emerged as a vital approach to address the environmental challenges faced by modern cities. As urban populations continue to grow at unprecedented rates, city planners and architects are increasingly focusing on creating living spaces that minimize negative environmental impacts while maximizing quality of life for residents. These sustainable approaches often incorporate renewable energy sources, efficient public transportation systems, and careful land use planning to reduce carbon footprints and promote ecological balance.

(2) One of the most visible aspects of sustainable urban planning is the integration of green spaces throughout city landscapes. Urban parks, community gardens, and green roofs serve multiple functions beyond their aesthetic appeal. They help reduce the urban heat island effect, improve air quality by filtering pollutants, provide habitats for local wildlife, and offer recreational spaces that enhance residents' physical and mental well-being. Cities like Singapore have successfully implemented extensive green infrastructure, with gardens and parks covering nearly half of the city-state's land area.

(3) Water management represents another crucial component of eco-friendly urban design. Sustainable cities implement systems to collect and reuse rainwater, reduce water consumption, and prevent flooding through permeable surfaces and strategic placement of water-retaining features. Barcelona's innovative approach includes water-sensitive urban design elements such as rain gardens and bioswales that capture stormwater runoff, while Copenhagen has redesigned many public spaces to serve as water storage areas during heavy rainfall events, thereby preventing urban flooding.

(4) Transportation infrastructure plays a significant role in creating sustainable urban environments. Cities at the forefront of sustainable planning prioritize public transit, cycling, and pedestrian infrastructure over car-centric development. They establish extensive networks of bike lanes, pedestrian-friendly streets, and efficient public transportation systems powered by clean energy sources. This approach not only reduces greenhouse gas emissions but also alleviates traffic congestion, improves air quality, and promotes healthier lifestyles among urban residents.

(5) Perhaps the most challenging aspect of sustainable urban planning is retrofitting existing cities rather than building new ones from scratch. Many urban centers worldwide were designed during eras with little concern for environmental sustainability. Transforming these established urban areas requires innovative approaches to renovate buildings for energy efficiency, reclaim streets for pedestrians and cyclists, and introduce green spaces in densely developed areas. Despite these challenges, cities like Malm√∂, Sweden demonstrate that transforming industrial areas into sustainable neighborhoods is not only possible but can also revitalize urban economies while significantly reducing environmental impacts.

questions.question: Which of the following is grammatically correct?

options.A: She have been studying for three hours.
options.B: They has completed the project ahead of schedule.
options.C: He didn't studied for the exam yesterday.
options.D: We haven't seen that movie yet.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:

options.A: If I would have known about the meeting, I would have attended it.
options.B: If I had known about the meeting, I would have attended it.
options.C: If I known about the meeting, I would have attended it.
options.D: If I have known about the meeting, I would attended it.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of articles:

options.A: She is best student in the class.
options.B: I bought a new computer last week from the store.
options.D: We visited famous museum during our trip.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct form of the comparative?

options.A: This book is more better than the one I read last month.
options.B: Her presentation was more convincing than his.
options.C: The weather today is more colder than yesterday.
options.D: Their house is more bigger than ours.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with correct subject-verb agreement:

options.A: The team are playing well this season.
options.B: Each of the students have submitted their assignments.
options.C: Neither of the candidates was suitable for the position.
options.D: The quality of these products need to be improved.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of prepositions:

options.A: She arrived to the airport on time.
options.B: We're looking forward for the concert next week.
options.C: He's been working on this project since Monday.
options.D: They agreed with signing the contract yesterday.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct verb tense:

options.A: By the time we arrived, the movie already started.
options.B: I live in this city since 2010.
options.C: She has been working here for six months.
options.D: We will completed the assignment by tomorrow.

questions.question: Which sentence contains a correctly formed conditional?

options.A: If it rains tomorrow, we cancel the picnic.
options.B: If I would be you, I would apply for that job.
options.C: Unless you study harder, you won't pass the exam.
options.D: If she would have called, I would have told her.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with correct pronoun usage:

options.A: Between you and I, the project might be canceled.
options.B: Her and me decided to start a new business.
options.C: The manager gave the reports to my colleague and myself.
options.D: The teacher asked John and me to organize the event.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct passive voice construction:

options.A: The book has wrote by a famous author.
options.B: The window was broke during the storm.
options.C: The report is being prepared by the committee.
options.D: The house been built last year.

questions.question: Select the grammatically correct sentence:

options.A: She didn't need no help with her homework.
options.B: There's many reasons to consider this proposal.
options.C: Neither the students nor the teacher was late.
options.D: I wish I would have gone to the party last night.

questions.question: Which sentence uses modals correctly?

options.A: You must to submit your application by Friday.
options.B: She could solved the problem without any help.
options.C: We might have missed the train if we hadn't hurried.
options.D: They should went to the meeting yesterday.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with correct word order:

options.A: Always he arrives late to the meetings.
options.B: What time you will leave tomorrow?
options.C: I know where did they go last weekend.
options.D: She rarely has time to visit her parents.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct gerund/infinitive form:

options.A: They avoided to talk about the problem.
options.B: She enjoys to read historical novels.
options.C: We decided buying a new car next month.
options.D: He agreed to help us with the project.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of reported speech:

options.A: She said she has finished her homework already.
options.B: He told me that he will come to the party tomorrow.
options.C: They asked if we could help them with the move.
options.D: The teacher said that the test is very difficult.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: The company's new policy aims to _____ employees from using social media during work hours.
The scientists were able to _____ that the new treatment was effective after months of research.
She makes _____ trips to the library to conduct research for her thesis.
It took me a moment to _____ my old classmate after twenty years.
Proper nutrition is _____ for maintaining good health.
The artist is known for her _____ approach to traditional painting techniques.
The lawyer will _____ the client at the upcoming court hearing.
Many students _____ at the local shelter during their summer vacation.
All team members are expected to _____ in the weekly strategy meetings.
The two departments need to _____ more effectively to complete the project on time.
Children remain financially _____ on their parents until they can support themselves.
The new software is designed to _____ productivity in the workplace.
Starting a new business _____ requires significant planning and investment.
The meteorologist provided _____ weather predictions for the coming week.
She prepared thoroughly for the job _____ by researching the company.
Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: Despite the _____ weather, they decided to go hiking.
Select the appropriate phrasal verb: The meeting has been _____ until next week.
Choose the correct collocation: The government has implemented strict measures to _____ crime.
Select the correct idiom to complete the sentence: When it comes to technical knowledge, John is completely _____.
Choose the correct fixed expression: She's been working _____ to finish the project before the deadline.
Select the word that CANNOT be used with the adjective 'heavy':
Choose the correct linking word: She studied extremely hard; _____, she failed the exam.
Select the appropriate word to complete the sentence: His argument lacks _____ and is difficult to follow.
Choose the correct register for a formal email: _____

options.A: Hey there! Just checking if you got my previous message.
options.B: I am writing to inquire about the status of my application.
options.C: What's up with my application? Let me know ASAP.
options.D: Can you tell me about my application when you get a chance?

options.B: Primarily economic issues in urban areas
options.C: Environmental challenges while improving quality of life

options.B: Public transit, cycling, and pedestrian infrastructure
options.C: Eliminating all motorized transportation in urban centers

options.A: Creating new green spaces in cities

questions.question: What does the passage suggest about sustainable urban planning's economic impact?

options.A: It always increases city budgets substantially
options.B: It has no significant economic effects
